title: REN remi vs Team liquid, calm down guys.
body: Seriously, as soon the camera jumps on them, the chat box just goes INSANE fast screaming out remi's name and "IS that a GIRL?" like really. Calm down guys, its not the first time you seen a girl and there's TONS of girl twitch LoL players. And stop blaming her for any bad plays or why the game lasted an hour. Its not her fault, both teams in general played high defense looking for an opening on one another, not every team is super aggressive ending the game in 25-30 mins like an SKT

replies.body:
dude just dont. this is twitch chat. if they show someone dying on cancer i bet over 50% would still spam "haha this is what you kids get one day" there is no hope for twitch chat.
LoL streams are the only ones where i usually turn the chat off
That's why you go to the official Riot site. You get stats and you don't have to deal with Twitch chat.
true. sadly i have some laggs there but yea the page is op
I think the least laggy one is the YT stream, but that may be wrong. I still get just as bad (or worse) lag on the sites themselves.

twitch is okay now with the html5 update every stream was unwatchable but it works again. azubu usually has problems for me which is sad because it only has 8-10sec delay. youtube is also fine now, it had 70sec delay but now its like twitch with 12-18 sec
The fact that all NA teams seemed to take way too long to close out their games makes me worried for international competition already. :/

well, immortals can teach them...maybe. Though Koreans also tend to really play long games atm - still for other reasons though i guess (they know one kill early on can tilt the game already atm, so they are just really really carefull).

Remi is clearly a weak point. they flubbed at least 3 combos. REN had so much advantages, the alistar+kalista engage, crumbs with the baron steal, the fact they had MUNDO. Look what happens, they finally win eventually after an hour. I hope Monte smacks them all into playing better.

If I was any other team seeing that match, i'd let thresh through and pick/ban Alistar, and prolly also ban mundo or just pick something that can stand with him. It's concerning how long it took to win with everything they had (4? baron? Almost 5 dragon stacks too).

the weak-point of REN is clearly RF...and in this meta that just really hurts them majorly. Remi seemed a little nervous, but still got around the map very well early to mid and while there is room for improvment - the loss they have is on RF feeding Fiora.

> [{quoted}](name=Brahmsauce,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=3TUka3E0,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-01-17T16:23:16.516+0000)
>
> Remi is clearly a weak point. they flubbed at least 3 combos. REN had so much advantages, the alistar+kalista engage, crumbs with the baron steal, the fact they had MUNDO. Look what happens, they finally win eventually after an hour. I hope Monte smacks them all into playing better.
> 
> If I was any other team seeing that match, i'd let thresh through and pick/ban Alistar, and prolly also ban mundo or just pick something that can stand with him. It's concerning how long it took to win with everything they had (4? baron? Almost 5 dragon stacks too).

Piglet had Lucien and Fenix had Viktor. That is a ton of damage to deal with.

Not enough for mundo or enough protection from the insane amount of engage REN had. This should've been a sub 30min game with how stacked it was for them. But credit for TL to holding on for as long as they could(RIP baron steal), my point still stands we need to see how REN holds up when they don't have mundo or insane engage potential over their opponent.

"clearly a weak point" is a little strong of wording for 1 game. She didn't play that great but who knows how the whole season will go especially if the NA teams go on hot streaks and cold streaks like last split.

I have to agree with you on his Alistar play.   There were too many times when he was unnecessarily in front of the team at tower points soaking up needless damage and constantly popping his ult, just to stay alive.  And those were not even engagements.  I'll give him a pass on the flubbed combos, because it was his first experience int he NA LCS infront of a huge crowd.  But the repetitive damage soaking that shouldn't happen is a glaring weakness.  I guarantee teams are going to target him in the future because of this.
She posted on twitter after the match, saying that she was sorry that her plays were not the cleanest, because she was super nervous. She said she will try to get it together for today

Alistar was scary as fk, that first turret dive was nasty.

She dun gud.
CALLED IT. Look what happens when you take away alistar, kalista. #rekt. Remi was a walking pylon.
Sure there are lots of Girl Lolers, but I think she's the first in the LCS.
No. Not even close. Go look up "Team Sirens"
They never made it to the LCS.

All I know is Remi is a weak link. Doesn't have a huge champion pool. Ban Thresh and it cripples the player hard. Not to mention Remi walks up to the enemy team to give a kill and enabling TIP to secure mid tower. The Casters are calling Remi out on it and Pro players are picking up on it. Remi is a great Thresh player. Very good on Thresh, one of the best Threshes but you need more than that in the pro scene. Champion pool is just way to small.
The players don't read Twitch chat, hell, I don't read Twitch chat. Not sure why anyone that matters would care.
This thread is full of transphobia
Most people on twitch chat actually have never seen a girl other than their mother who brings them food or periodically changes their diapers.
